intro: Tetramyxis rubescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its smooth, reddish stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique floral structure common in the Euphorbiaceae family. Tetramyxis rubescens is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
